intro: Lappula macrophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. It belongs to the family Chenopdiaceae, which includes other species with similar ecological preferences. Lappula macrophylla is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid environments.
